title: Drawing, "Justice, Vaulted Ceiling Design, Palazzo Quirinale, Rome", 1812
medium: Pen and dark gray ink, brush and gray wash over black chalk ruled lines on light greenish-beige wove paper
provenance: Giovanni Piancastelli; Mr. and Mrs. Edward D. Brandegee
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund
description: Panel of trapezoidal ceiling vault with horizontal octagon of Justice sitting between putto with fasces and putto with book, flanked by tondi of Victories in chariots.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Justice, Vaulted Ceiling Design, Palazzo Quirinale, Rome", 1812.
1812. Pen and dark gray ink, brush and gray wash over black chalk ruled lines on light greenish-beige wove paper. Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund. 1938-88-3071.
